body_content.explanation: a vehicle or device for removing snow from roads or railroads:
examples: A snowplow clearing a street can block a driveway.
A team of 56 snowplows continues to chip away to widen lanes in Cleveland.

body_content.explanation: in skiing, a simple way of turning or stopping in which the points of the skis are turned toward each other:
examples: The snowplow is a beginning skiing technique.
To a novice the snowplow turn is the start of real downhill skiing.

body_content.explanation: in skiing, to turn or stop with the points of the skis turned toward each other:
examples: We had practised, endlessly, snowplowing to control our speed.
I was amazed to see my daughter snowplowing her way through a sort of obstacle course.

body_content.explanation: to remove or deal with problems for a child, so they never have to do anything difficult or never fail, and do not learn how to do things for themselves:
examples: By snowplowing all opposition and doing everything for them, they may be robbing their children of confidence and self-reliance.

body_content.explanation: used to refer to a parent who removes or deals with problems for a child, so they never have to do anything difficult or never fail, and do not learn how to do things for themselves:
examples: Having a snowplow parent is not good for a child in the long run.
Snowplow mothers and fathers are criticized for clearing every difficulty from their child’s path.
